TestChild7.maturitySetting: Junior Mode (curated kids UI, TV-Y walled garden)

PE-01.label: Unprotected
PE-01.description: Child can exit Junior Mode via profile dropdown 'Exit Junior Mode' button — goes directly to full profile picker with ALL profiles visible (Profile/Adult, TestChild12, TestChild7, TestTeen16) and ZERO authentication. Clicked adult 'Profile' and immediately landed on full adult home with TV-MA content (Family Guy TV-MA, Love Story TV-MA, Beatles: Get Back TV-MA visible in recommendations). No PIN, no password, no confirmation dialog.
PE-01.cfoEffect: Grade capped at D (Critical failure on Child-7 Junior Mode profile)

SD-01.label: Full Block
SD-01.description: Searching for 'Deadpool' (R) returns 'No results found for Deadpool'. Searching for 'Family Guy' (TV-MA) also returns no results. Search is fully scoped to Junior Mode content. Explore section shows only kids categories (Muppets, Disney Junior, Cars, Mickey Mouse, Princesses). Footer notice: 'Some content may be hidden due to parental controls.'

DU-01.label: Full Block
DU-01.description: Direct URL to mature content entity redirects to Junior Mode home page with modal dialog: 'Content for the request could not be found.' with OK button. Content existence is NOT revealed — no title, no 'switch profile' prompt, no metadata exposed. Superior to Peacock's 'switch profile' prompt approach.

KM-01.label: Full Block
KM-01.description: Junior Mode provides a curated walled garden with simplified navigation (HOME, WATCHLIST, MOVIES, SERIES, ORIGINALS, SEARCH — no LIVE, no Hulu/ESPN tabs). Movies page accessible but only shows kids content (Princess and the Frog, Lion King, Tinker Bell, Cars, Finding Nemo, Toy Story, Ratatouille). Categories limited to Featured, Action/Adventure, Animation, Comedy, Shorts. Zero mature content accessible through any navigation path within Junior Mode.

RL-01.label: Full Block
RL-01.description: Junior Mode home page exclusively shows kid-appropriate content. All titles TV-Y rated: Sofia the First (TV-Y), Spidey and his Amazing Friends (TV-Y), RoboGobo (TV-Y), Hey AJ! (TV-Y), Firebuds (TV-Y), Bluey Minisodes (TV-Y), SuperKitties (TV-Y), CoComelon (TV-Y), Mickey Mouse Clubhouse+ (TV-Y). Content rows: Featured, Disney Junior, Princesses and Fairy Tales. Zero mature content leakage.

CB-01.label: Full Block
CB-01.description: Watchlist page empty — 'You haven't added anything yet.' No cross-profile data visible. Fresh account with properly isolated profile data.

CG-01.label: Full Block
CG-01.description: Ratings displayed correctly and consistently. Spidey and his Amazing Friends shows TV-Y rating badge. Each episode individually marked 'Rated TV-Y'. 4 Seasons metadata visible. Content descriptors shown appropriately.

PL-01.label: Full Block / N/A
PL-01.description: No PIN gate needed on Junior Mode profile — content is blocked at the profile level. Mature content completely inaccessible within the Junior Mode walled garden. Direct URLs show 'Content not found' rather than content or profile switch prompt.

MF-01.label: Full Block
MF-01.description: Maturity filter comprehensively blocks all mature content across search, recommendations, browse, and direct URLs. Only TV-Y content visible in Junior Mode. Footer transparency notice on search: 'Some content may be hidden due to parental controls.' Direct URL is cleanly blocked with no metadata exposure.

TestChild12.notes: Non-Junior Mode child profile (DOB age 12). Uses full adult browsing UI with Hulu/ESPN/LIVE tabs but content filtered to TV-14 and below. Created with COPPA consent and password confirmation (under 13).

PE-01.label: Unprotected
PE-01.description: Child can navigate to /select-profile and switch to any profile (including Adult) with zero authentication. All profiles visible. No PIN, no password, no confirmation. Same critical vulnerability as Junior Mode.
PE-01.cfoEffect: Grade capped at D (Critical failure on Child-12 profile)

SD-01.label: Full Block
SD-01.description: Searching for 'Deadpool' (R) returns 'No results found for Deadpool'. Searching for 'Family Guy' (TV-MA) returns only 'Family by the Ton' (TV-14) — the actual Family Guy show is completely hidden. Search page footer: 'Your profile is set to TV-14. Titles above this rating will not appear. To update your content rating, go to profile settings.'

DU-01.label: Full Block
DU-01.description: Direct URL to Family Guy (TV-MA) via /series/family-guy/5H2bPEHtK7Wi silently redirects to home page. No error dialog, no content revealed, no 'switch profile' prompt. Content completely invisible. Even cleaner than Junior Mode's 'content not found' dialog.

KM-01.label: N/A
KM-01.description: TestChild12 is NOT in Kids/Junior Mode — uses full adult browsing UI with HOME, LIVE, WATCHLIST, MOVIES, SERIES, ORIGINALS, SEARCH navigation plus Hulu/ESPN/Disney+ tabs. Content filtering is applied at the content-rating level rather than through a walled garden. All browsable content is TV-14 or below.

RL-01.label: Full Block
RL-01.description: Home page recommendations all TV-14 or below: Scrubs (TV-14), The Rookie (TV-14), Wonder Man (TV-14), Grey's Anatomy (TV-14), Dancing with the Stars (TV-PG), Percy Jackson (TV-PG), Avatar: The Way of Water (PG-13). Bingeable Series: The Simpsons, 9-1-1, Futurama, Bob's Burgers, Gravity Falls, The Mandalorian. Zero TV-MA content visible.

CG-01.label: Full Block
CG-01.description: Ratings displayed correctly. TV-14 badge clearly visible on all content. Content rating notice shown on profile entry and search page.

PL-01.label: Full Block / N/A
PL-01.description: Content blocked at the content-rating filter level. TV-MA content completely hidden — cannot even be found to attempt playback. No PIN gate needed.

MF-01.label: Full Block
MF-01.description: Maturity filter comprehensively blocks all TV-MA content across search, recommendations, browse, and direct URLs. TV-14 ceiling strictly enforced. Transparent notices on search page and profile entry: 'Your profile is set to TV-14. Titles above this rating will not appear.' Content-rating-based approach means no metadata exposure at all for blocked content. Superior to Peacock's teen profile which shows full TV-MA metadata.

TestTeen16.notes: Teen profile (DOB age 16). No COPPA consent or password required during creation (over 13). Uses identical full adult browsing UI and TV-14 content filtering as TestChild12. Disney+ does not differentiate between 12-year-old and 16-year-old at the TV-14 content rating level.

PE-01.label: Unprotected
PE-01.description: Teen can switch to any profile (including Adult) from profile picker with zero authentication. All profiles visible. Same critical vulnerability as all other profiles.

SD-01.label: Full Block
SD-01.description: Searching for 'Deadpool' (R) returns 'No results found for Deadpool'. TV-MA content completely hidden from search. Same behavior as TestChild12 since both are set to TV-14.

DU-01.label: Full Block
DU-01.description: Same as TestChild12 — direct URLs to TV-MA content silently redirect to home page. No content revealed.

KM-01.label: N/A
KM-01.description: Not in Kids/Junior Mode. Uses full adult browsing UI with content-rating-based filtering.

RL-01.label: Full Block
RL-01.description: Home page recommendations all TV-14 or below: Star Wars: Attack of the Clones (PG), Ahsoka (TV-14), Blippi (TV-G), Thunderbolts* (PG-13), BUNK'D (TV-G), My Hero Academia (TV-14), Pirates of the Caribbean (PG-13), Captain America: Brave New World (PG-13), Bob's Burgers (TV-14). Zero TV-MA content visible.

PL-01.label: Full Block / N/A
PL-01.description: Content blocked at content-rating filter level. TV-MA content completely hidden.

MF-01.label: Full Block
MF-01.description: Identical to TestChild12. TV-14 ceiling strictly enforced. All TV-MA content hidden from search, browse, recommendations, and direct URLs. No metadata exposure. Disney+ content-rating-based approach is significantly better than Peacock's teen profile which exposes full TV-MA metadata while only blocking playback.

criticalFailures.description: Critical failure on all profiles: Profile Escape allows switching to Adult profile with zero authentication

platformNotes.juniorModeStrength: Excellent curated walled garden — dedicated 'Junior Mode' with simplified navigation (no LIVE/Hulu/ESPN tabs), search scoped to kids content, 'Some content may be hidden due to parental controls' transparency notice. Only TV-Y content visible. Direct URLs show 'Content not found' dialog with no metadata exposure.
platformNotes.juniorModeWeakness: Zero-auth profile switching via 'Exit Junior Mode' dropdown option is a critical vulnerability. One click exits to full profile picker with all profiles visible including Adult.
platformNotes.contentRatingApproach: Disney+ uses content-rating-based filtering (TV-Y, TV-G, TV-PG, TV-14, TV-MA) rather than age-based tiers. Non-Junior profiles with TV-14 setting use the full adult browsing UI but TV-MA content is completely hidden — not just playback-blocked, but invisible from search, browse, recommendations, and direct URLs.
platformNotes.tv14vsTvma: Critical design difference vs Peacock: Disney+ hides TV-MA content entirely from TV-14 profiles (no metadata exposure). Peacock's teen profile shows full TV-MA detail pages with cast, descriptions, episode lists, and content descriptors — only blocking playback. Disney+'s approach is significantly more protective.
platformNotes.profileCreation: 3-step creation: avatar selection → name/DOB/Junior Mode toggle → content rating prompt. Under-13 profiles require account password re-entry and COPPA consent. 13+ profiles require neither. Content rating prompt offers 'FULL CATALOG' (TV-MA) or 'NOT NOW' (TV-14) — we selected 'NOT NOW' for all test profiles.
platformNotes.noAgeGranularity: TestChild12 (age 12) and TestTeen16 (age 16) have identical experiences when both set to TV-14. Disney+ does not differentiate based on actual age — only the content rating setting matters. The only age-based differentiation is Junior Mode availability and COPPA consent requirements.
platformNotes.profileTypes: Junior Mode (curated kids UI with TV-Y content), Non-Junior with TV-14 (full adult UI with content filtering), Non-Junior with TV-MA (unrestricted adult access). Junior Mode can only be enabled at profile creation time.
platformNotes.passwordProtection: Account password required to create under-13 profiles and to enable Junior Mode. COPPA consent dialog shown for under-13. However, NO password/PIN required to switch between profiles or exit Junior Mode.
platformNotes.transparencyNotices: Disney+ shows clear notices: 'Your content rating is set to TV-14' on profile entry, 'Some content may be hidden due to parental controls' on Junior Mode search, 'Titles above this rating will not appear' on non-Junior search pages.

vs_peacock.kidsProfile: Disney+ Junior Mode is superior to Peacock Kids — both block search and recommendations, but Disney+ returns 'Content not found' on direct URLs vs Peacock's 'switch to non-kids profile' prompt (which reveals content existence and provides zero-auth profile picker). Both share the same critical PE-01 vulnerability.
vs_peacock.teenProfile: Disney+ is SIGNIFICANTLY better — TV-MA content is completely invisible (search, browse, recommendations, direct URLs all return nothing). Peacock's teen profile shows full TV-MA detail pages with title, cast, RT scores, content descriptors, episode lists — only blocking playback. Disney+ blocks at the discovery layer, Peacock blocks at the playback layer.
vs_peacock.overallDesign: Disney+ uses content-rating-based filtering that hides content entirely. Peacock uses profile-type restrictions with playback blocking but metadata exposure. Disney+'s approach is more protective but both fail on profile switching authentication.

vs_prime_video.kidsProfile: Disney+ Junior Mode comparable to Prime Video Kids profile. Both block search and recommendations. Disney+'s DU-01 handling is better ('content not found' vs PV's 'Age restricted' message). Both share PE-01 critical failure.
vs_prime_video.teenProfile: Disney+ TV-14 filtering is superior to all tested platforms for teen profiles — no metadata exposure at all. PV gates playback with PIN (weak) while exposing metadata.
vs_prime_video.overallDesign: Disney+ has the strongest content filtering of platforms tested so far. The only critical weakness is the universal zero-auth profile switching vulnerability shared by all platforms.

vs_netflix.kidsProfile: Similar overall protection level in walled gardens. Both block search and recommendations for kids profiles.
vs_netflix.teenProfile: Disney+ TV-14 profiles have zero metadata exposure for TV-MA content — superior to Netflix teen profiles.
vs_netflix.profileSwitching: All platforms share the same critical zero-auth profile switching vulnerability.
